Very unfortunate, there were high hopes... Young guys, sigh... Well, alright. Thank you. Talk to our junior assistant, maybe he has some work for you. Damn it, these groups are a real problem!
So, everything's ready?
Yes, the Duty squad is already approaching the Radar. They will be waiting for you there, at the entrance to the territory.
Understood, I'm on my way.
I hope you're well prepared for this outing?
Don't worry about that. At least we have a whole squad.
Well, I guess you know what you're getting into. Alright, the Duty recon reported that Monolith fanatics have become active there, so be careful: they're real psychos.
I'll manage.
That's what I think too, good luck!
Hi.
Well, well... Ah, so you did bring it after all!
So, this is your handiwork?
Yes, he knew too much - had to get rid of him. Well done for bringing it: our sniper couldn't get close to the warehouse and retrieve it himself - here, take yours. And now, please leave our den.
Hey, stalker. Was it you who disabled the installation at Yantar?
Yes, that was me. And who are you? What are you doing here?
I'm the only remaining member of the Final Day group. Hiding out here... But anyway, go where you were going, stalker!
Hello! What's with that suit you're wearing?

Hello to you too. Oh, you want one like this too? Hm, well if you're at one of our scientific bases, at Lake Yantar or in the Swamp, talk to the bosses, maybe they'll take you on as a staff member. I myself started stalking recently...
I'll keep that in mind.
We seem to have met somewhere before...

Hm, maybe so. Aren't you the Messer from the Death Truck? Heard about you. I'll tell you, there are several groups operating right now. If you want to join us, talk to someone from the scientific top.
We'll see...
Is there more work?
Alright, I'll do it.
The controller is dead.
Excellent, you've been a great help to Duty! I knew I could count on you. If the opportunity arises, I'll put you in charge of one of our expeditions into the depths of the Zone.
Agreed.
I found something, a diary or something. Is this what you needed?
Yes, that's it. How did it go?
I was ambushed: the Killers tracked me down, maybe they wanted these records, but I managed to break away. How did they get into Rostok?
What do you need?
Hey, what are you looking for?
Listen, I'm busy! Get out of here!
Alright, simmer down!
See ya!
What do you want?
Have you heard anything about Gunslinger?
I haven't heard of anyone like that.
And what about the Journalist?
No, haven't heard anything! Don't bother me!
Ah, I'm fed up with this Zone... We should drop everything and get out of here!
I understand you...
Where... Where am I?
What? Who are you... How did you pass the checkpoint? It's chaos over there...
I... I remember disabling the installations... The brain link is destroyed... I need to get out of the Zone urgently. I have information about what's going on behind the station!
Where? Wait, were you affected by the installations up North? You're not zombified, are you, kid? Answer!
I was there, behind the station, in the Generator area! I managed to sneak into the lab, they're there... They're behind everything that's happening here! I need to leave the Zone.
You won't get through the checkpoints and patrols in this state for sure. You know what? It's better for you to leave now... I don't know you, so just go.
What are you doing here?
Hello, Gunslinger. I knew you'd be here, I think my help will definitely come in handy for you. Ready to head to the bunker entrance?
Hm, alright, let's go, assistant.
Let's go.
How's your research going?

Finally, you've arrived! Overall, everything's successful: it seems we managed to modify the genetic structure of the bacteria in the sample you brought, and as we believe, it acquired an interesting property.
What property?
We can't say for sure, but the artifact gained the ability to protect its carrier from being infected by the parasite spores. You've probably encountered such creatures before.
Yes, I have.
As a token of your delivery of the sample and the successful research, take the artifact you've obtained. Now, I think encounters with parasites won't be a problem for you. But still, be cautious.
I have an artifact "Slime" for your research.
Excellent, you've decided to make a selfless donation to science after all! Come here, in the future, this may turn out to be a profitable investment for you.
And what will you do with it?
We have some information regarding the resistance of the bacteria inside the artifact to various viruses and parasites, but I'm not ready to talk about it yet.
When will you be ready?
After the research is completed! We'll send you a message about the results we obtain, don't worry!
I wanted to ask you about this artifact, "Slime," which... There aren't many of them in the Zone, right?
That's correct. Since we've been here, we haven't managed to obtain a sample for research even once. But I think you can help with that.
And how exactly?
There's one way to determine the location of such an artifact here, in the Zone. Don't ask how. We'll send you a message when something becomes clear.
Alright, but what properties does this artifact have? Is it safe?
If you donate the found sample to us, we'll be able to conduct research on its unique properties. And, in turn, share the discovery with you. So, expect a message, stalker.
It seems I have something for you.
Excellent, we need the artifacts "Slime" and "Burning Fleece". For each such artifact, we're ready to pay you a considerable amount.
Here's the Slime, take it.
We have the Burning Fleece, take it.
Nothing here.
It doesn't seem very safe here, and I don't see much security from you. How do you plan to work here at all?
Have you been to the Yantar Scientific Station? Maybe you've already seen the security system there, which destroys mutants with a certain impact - we have a similar system.
And is that enough?

Quite! The impact is only on mutants, although it has happened that... Oh, by the way, you can use it too if necessary. The control panel is here, at the entrance. Keep in mind that the radius of action is small and the system requires recharging!
Are you the new scientific group? You've chosen a pretty dangerous place to work.

Yes, that's us! And the place, by the way, is quite something: there's a lot of material we need for research here! You've probably noticed that this complex is covered with clusters of anomalous vegetation.
So, you're studying the local flora?
You could say that. We specialize in the "Slime" and "Burning Fleece" artifacts, as well as anomalies of plant origin. You seem to have come for business, am I right?
You okay?
Oh, damn, stalker... help... I, I think...
Hang on, wait, I'll get the medkit.
Ah... It won't help me... There are several thorn artifacts... they could help... Look around here, nearby. Ah...
Oh, my head...
Damn, I really overdid it...
Oh, damn...
What a day it turned out to be...
Hold on, buddy.
Bloodsucker, damn... Didn't see it... while I was hunting flesh... it crept up...
Hold on, I'll get the artifacts.

There are two Black Thorns, don't move around too much, conserve your strength. I won't stay with you for long. Take off the artifacts in about an hour, then get some sleep for about six hours - you'll be good as new.
I know, thanks... How much... do I owe you?
I know, thanks... How much... do I owe you?
You won't take anything from me...
Altruists in the Zone... don't live long.
And I'm not an altruist. Maybe someday I'll find myself in a similar situation...
They say you...
Are lying.
You're lying!
Well, as you wish. Ah... damn, it hurts...

Some kind of diary... At the heart of the Zone, right in the center of the ruined Chernobyl NPP, there is Something that controls the spread of the Zone, something that controls a huge army of zombies, mutated animals, horrifying creatures, and entities unknown to anyone. This entity takes control of military units, turns peaceful inhabitants of nearby settlements into zombies, and forces large groups of creatures to attack military checkpoints. This entity is the Black Monolith, created by an unknown ancient race millions of years ago in Earth's orbit. The Monolith was created long before the first bacteria appeared in the raging oceans of Earth...

%c[255,160,181,169]Snitch:\n%c[255,245,240,218]So, info on the last group: they call themselves "Happy Tourists" - a big gang of veteran bandits. They were seen at the Agroprom, don't know exactly where. You need to eliminate the leader from the group, the rest are up to you. Be careful.
Snitch, the group in the Valley is already dead. I'm a bit late.
%c[255,160,181,169]Snitch:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Got it. Looks like Duty got busy earlier. Wait for info on the next group, according to my data, it's the last one.
%c[255,160,181,169]Snitch:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Regarding our next group: they call themselves "Malboro Cowboys", they were seen in the Dark Valley, in the ruined village. Act on it.

%c[255,160,181,169]Snitch:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Great. Got info on the next group: they call themselves "Gutrippers" - complete scum. So much so that they were seen in the Bar, in the center. You got the tip.
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Stalker, what's going on? Did the assistant die?! Return immediately!

Pre-Zone, army checkpoint. In the cellar behind the village, near the army checkpoint, you'll find a trader. I don't advise going to the checkpoint and catching the soldiers' attention: they have orders to shoot without warning. You can't kill soldiers, only in extreme cases, for each killed one, you have to pay the trader, and he won't be happy with that situation. On the plains, there are large packs of blind dogs, only the suicidal ones go near them.

This is a big stinking dump where mountains of radioactive garbage were dumped after the accident in '86: broken cranes, machinery, remnants of old buildings. Mostly rookies and, of course, bandits hang around here. You can encounter mutants, find small artifacts, but it's better not to stay here for long. Further on, there are a lot of radiation hotspots - you can't go there without protection.

Stalkers call this area the Dead Territory - the radiation here is too strong. If you move deeper into the territory, you'll reach radioactive plains. You can find a small rusty lake here, all filled with car wrecks - one big heap of rusty junk slightly covered in water. You can also find an old institute and factory, but it's overrun with some mutated filth. Don't go without a gas mask - you'll get a dose just like that.

This is the Dark Valley, it's always gloomy and misty here. Often raining. Moreover, one of the highest concentrations of anomalies is here - you can get some good artifacts, or easily lose your life. You'll definitely meet veterans here, they earn money pulling artifacts out of the ass, so to speak. I heard talk about the Slime gang, like they showed up again, but who knows, maybe they've all been shot already. There's an entrance to the lab, but nobody returns from there, so I don't recommend poking around there. Heard about dwarves... or maybe something scarier.

Before the '86 accident, this was a typical urban settlement. Now, as you understand, these are the ruins of the former settlement. In the local underground cafe of the grocery store, you'll find the stalker bar, where stalkers from all over the Zone gather, the local trader works here as a bartender... maintaining, so to speak, the establishment. You should go there if you want to trade, chat, get an interesting task, and find out the latest news. If you go from the settlement, you'll come to the old "Rostok" factory, behind the factory is the base of the Duty group. The base is closed to outsiders, I don't advise barging in there.

This factory is gloomy, I'll tell you. So many of ours fell there... there are simply no words. Bloodsuckers have multiplied there, damn creatures. They started crawling out at night, and as you know, they get stronger when they drink blood. But they say something important is at this factory, something vital. Recently, some guys from Duty went there, and they all vanished, we heard their screams all day around. Don't go there, let them all rot there, those bloodsuckers.

The legendary Yantar Lake, oh yes, I know it well. Black, oily... It devours stalker souls, as soon as you approach the shore - poof! And you're gone, just an empty shell splashing into the water and there... towards the island, drifting in the mist... And dummy-zombies roam around, spot you - start howling and chasing after you, so you better move your feet, because there are many of them, former stalkers, who perished on this lake, and now only dummies wander. If you bypass the lake and the zombies, you'll find the scientific camp, they're studying something there. They even have a helicopter that brings them supplies regularly, so they've entrenched themselves pretty well there. You can have a chat with them, they buy artifacts, might even ask you to do something.

There's an abandoned military base there, an old village, and a small lake. And at the military base, a group settled in, called "Sin," - former religious fanatics, believed in the divine essence of the Zone, and now they themselves turned into something incomprehensible. Rumor has it they are under mutant control. All PDAs of the members of this group suddenly went offline, and nothing has been heard of them since.

The Light Beam - a city of zombies and the Freedom faction, which includes all the anarchist scumbags of the Zone. Snipers-anarchists sit in high-rise buildings and shoot everyone who's not one of them. So think twice before heading there.
Let me tell you a couple of jokes... before the finale. The first one - you're not the Marked One...
And the second one... Do you think I'm real?
Kid, help, I'm dying...
Kid, hurry, I'm in a real bad shape...
Looks like this is a guard from the camp.

in rubles. Here, take it.

Have you heard about the legend of the Monolith? Well, I've heard it too, and I think all these rumors must have some truth to them, otherwise where would they come from at all? Maybe it's really possible to reach it...

I'll tell you straight: I want to find the reason for the Zone's appearance and achieve its disappearance. I think it's necessary to stop the spread of all this infection. After all, if not me, then who?
Well, I have some old scores to settle, even before the Zone. And then I found out that one, let's say, old acquaintance ended up here, so... I won't say anything else about it.
What do you think? Of course, cash! What else is there to do here? I don't understand these scientists, what's the idea they're toying with here.
I'm here, so to speak, as a tourist. The place is truly unique! I think nowhere else can you get such an adrenaline rush as here. Do you understand what I mean?
I ran away here in an attempt to figure myself out. Perhaps to rediscover the value of life, who knows...
What's your purpose inquiring? You're not with the authorities, are you? Hey man, let's just part ways on good terms, huh?
Not your business, beat it!
Money received - 1100.
A message came from an unknown source here.
I know you were looking for the Journalist. Enter the house in the city center, I can help you.
Ha! Some dude crashed out in the open, probably in the tenth dream. And drunk, it seems. Well, he shared some loot with me...
He's here!
They came... Only, it seems, the door is closed. Maybe the code is somewhere around here or maybe you have some notes?
We need to check the PDA, maybe there's something...

%c[255,160,181,169]Message:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Stalker, do you copy? Have you reached the station? It's... Well, it's better if we meet, I'm here too. More precisely, already beyond it. In the area where there are something like generators. Waiting.
Hmm, who could this be?
Hrom: Attention everyone on the road from the swamps. Right now, although we drove the fanatics out of there, there's no guarantee they won't show up again.
This is my ghost, part of my inner chaos. A haunting illusion that pursues me everywhere, in all my wanderings...

Something not belonging to this world. If you destroy me, you will inherit it, as I once inherited it, long ago killing a stalker. But it's not as simple as it seems - the shadow leads the bearer to inevitable death, sooner or later it will lead you to death. Follow my example.
Yeah, when you take the measurement, don't forget to bring the device itself.
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Stalker, do you have any findings? Come back when you're done, I have another task for you.

Attention all stalkers! The mobile camp on the territory of Lake Yantar announces recruitment for the guard group! Those interested should contact the Professor directly. Terms are negotiated upon meeting.

The equipment is already detecting weak psi-activity.

Firstly, your group is not the only one. Secondly, we could just inform the others where you dug your burrow. Besides, after today's circus, when your whole gang couldn't handle one crazy zombie for half an hour...

%c[255,160,181,169]Major Kravtsov:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, talked to my brother, good job. Come to me too, I have a matter to discuss.

Messer, what's going on with you?! We agreed that you would search for documents in the lab! You're taking too long, stalker, oh, how long! Anyway, head to the Valley, you'll find one hanger-on there, quite a colorful guy, discuss the lab with him. He should know something about it. That's it, end of communication.
Alright, looks like we made it. Go through the Garbage to the Bar, I'll be waiting for you there. We'll meet at our base.
Come to us, we need to talk. Don't flaunt your weapon too much at our base - no one will touch you if you don't start shooting yourself. Sent the coordinates.
Killer Base.

It's already night, I advise you not to wander around at this time. If you decide to spend the night, I have a basement next to the bunker. I don't recommend sleeping in the open field - you'll get eaten, and if you're not eaten, your colleagues won't mind playing a prank on you when they pass by.

I repeat, he must be eliminated, the fate of the entire Zone may depend on it! Currently, he is disconnected from the stalker network and is unaware of our actions.

Major Kravtsov speaking. The guys from the checkpoint reported that you seem to have handled it, they were watching you. Well done! I'll put in a word for you with our leader. When you have time, come by, I have something to discuss.

Well, well, a new face in our parts! The Southern checkpoint has already reported about you. This is the head of security of the Duty faction, Major Kravtsov, speaking. Come by, we need to talk. You'll find me at our base.
Doctor!

Only one thing bothers and haunts me - it's my memory. Or rather, my amnesia.

Security, come in. We know the laws of our territory - I order the execution of the killer. Did you understand?

%c[255,160,181,169]Message:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Can you believe it! You know that guy from the death truck? What kind of people are they... He took everything bad from the bar, right off the tables! We and the guys were just amazed, that's some audacity, huh! Well, nothing, we'll remember...

... Just so you know...
is a corpse right now. See for yourselves, for those who don't believe.

This is Kolbat. Come over - seems like something worked out. Oh, and bring your bayonet knife - got an idea.

Thank you, stalker, for your help! The Professor asked to convey: after completing the task, head to their base. There's something for you there.

What the hell?! You! Return here immediately to me!

Receiving your signal from the city... Yeah, you've wandered far, buddy, didn't think you'd make it there at all. Looks like this is it. Need to destroy these vials...
You've found what you were looking for after all. Need to find the main control center and deal with it...

Gunslinger, this is Toad. I know where you are and where you're heading. Right now you have two paths: the first one is through Pripyat, but what's going on there now, I can only vaguely imagine. I know the city's on fire, and the radiation levels are off the charts - can't pass through without protection for sure. The second path is to go along the old road to the station. There's something with psi-radiation there, some spikes have been observed, but it's likely a safe route.

Besides, I've heard that a military group has disappeared near the old road, so there's a chance to get some equipment. I'll put in a good word for you, because it wouldn't be good for you to be a Monolithian.
Messer, this is Snitch. Got documents, come and get them.
Approximate location of the document cache.
...I hid the stuff for now, because there's no room in my backpack. I've also put out my documents, or the bandits might get to me. I'll write it down so I don't forget where I left it:
Stalker with psi weapon documentation
Messer, this is the Snitch. About the paperwork, I found out about this guy, his name is
the last time they saw him. Well, that's where you'll find him, I've got a mark for you. Oh, and I suggest you hurry before he disappears. I'm done.
Messer, it's the Snitch. Sorry, I don't have any data on your stalker, so I can help you by getting the docs myself. Come on over if you need anything, but don't forget the money.
A middleman for Duty's medical supplies.

Messer, it seems like the Duty medic sent you to me? Well, I've already sent those medications, the guy has already left me. I'm dropping his marker to your PDA, if you really need them, deal with him yourself.
. Just remember, the marker won't stay on him for long for certain reasons, so hurry up.
Documentation on the Whirlwinds of Madness... Rat mentioned this - it should come in handy.
We need to shoot down these damn psychos... and find our things.
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]What have they done to me? Well, Rat... I'll remember this.
%c[255,160,181,169]Wish:\n%c[255,245,240,218]I want to remember everything!
There's progress on the Hoplite PDA, you can come by, just don't forget the Dead Head for the job.
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]"Damn, looks like the ground here, in the valley, is full of acid - need protection to walk here. Maybe the scientists can advise on something?

%c[255,160,181,169]Toad:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, there's information about the Guide: to the north of the Garbage, there's a Duty checkpoint, he was seen there. Try talking to members of the group, maybe someone knows something specific. It seems like a Duty member named Boar saw something, talk to him, just don't dawdle, he won't wait! And then come to me, I'll be waiting with the Eye.
Boar

%c[255,160,181,169]Toad:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, I've gathered some more information about your Guide. So, there's this stalker, named Yaroslav, rumored to have traveled with the Guide to Pripyat. I think you should talk to him about this. He's currently at the Duty checkpoint in the Garbage, although he might bail. I've dropped his marker for you, in short.
Stalker who knows something about Gunslinger.
Is this your so-called twice-born?

Stalker, it's the Freedom faction speaking. I know you helped us once, and we want to ask you for another favor. You're at the station now, right? A year ago, one of our groups disappeared in its northern part. We received some messages from there back then, but now it's clear they're dead. They should have a red folder with them, it's very valuable to us. Try to get it - we'll be extremely grateful!
Hmm...\nLooks like the documents should be somewhere around here.
Scientist with information 1
Scientist with information 2
Scientist with information 3
Unknown SOS signal
%c[255,160,181,169]SOS message:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Anyone, help... I'm in a house, on the outskirts.

Have you heard about Goliath, the one hanging out at the bar? Rumor has it he was eating human flesh - I remember he was always peddling canned meat! And they also saw Messer with him, as if he wasn't his accomplice...
Remember the number - 10.
Waiting for you at the black wigwam.
Stalker, come to the bar about our business.
Stalker, still alive, damn it? I have a task for you... You're planning to head North, right? I can sponsor your journey in exchange for one service.

Here, where I am now, Killers have appeared - also known as Hired Killers, doesn't matter - scum that does all the dirty work for money. They've settled at the former base of Grekha. They've got something unique there, an artifact worth a lot of money. Rumor has it, they got it straight from the Center.

Remember those orders for artifacts I gave you? It looks just like those artifacts, but with one difference, namely, as far as I could find out, under certain conditions it can cause an emission - that's why the tariff for it was tenfold.

So, here's the deal: the leader of these Killers is a guy named Dog, maybe he has the artifact. I don't advise you to go to their base, they've got snipers on their towers now - they'll shoot you on sight. Try checking the village by the road to the Bar, one of their groups is hanging out there now, maybe they know something about the artifact.
Throat slit from ear to ear... Blood darkened and clotted - the needles exhaled, couldn't close the wound. And who could have interfered with this damn dandelion? Hmm, personal PDA missing...
Should check Hoplite, as soon as I find something here...
Monolith... Does it really exist?
SPAWN 1
SPAWN 2
SPAWN 3

Messer, I received information that another death truck was seen in the Dump area. Just like the one they found you in. There's also a rumor going around that they saw zombies here, in the southern territories, which is not normal at all. Stalkers shot one of them, and he had a PDA with a note "Kill the marked one", just like yours. Draw your own conclusions.
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Idiots, what the hell are you shooting for?!
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, flesh is dead?! Damn, we're short on time, come back!
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, you can come to our bunker.
PDA Battery fully charged

Stalker, this is the commander. Thanks again for the help! Listen, I'm leaving the Zone anyway, so I'll share some info: we have a crate at our checkpoint, so our soldiers throw in all sorts of stuff they collect from stalkers. If you want, you can try sneaking in there quietly at night - no one's there at that time. Well, take care, maybe we'll see each other again!
%c[255,160,181,169]Digger:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Guys, that guy from the truck is cleverer and bolder than yours! Didn't chicken out to go to the attic of the factory!
Horek, come in, where are you?! Who's that idiot next to you rubbing shoulders on the Cordon? Get on our channel, we need to talk.
setcond offline food
Zob: Messer, thanks again for the help. I told the guys you seem okay, despite where and how they found you. You keep your word, and that means a lot.
Messer, listen up! That knife supposedly found by you in the Rostok underground is nothing like it! We'll have a talk about this scam, you and me.
Finally, we've got a devil's tube! When we head to the center of the Zone, no helicopter will be scary!
Attention everyone! The main group of the Freedom faction has returned to the Clear Sky. Anyone looking to earn some extra cash, come over.

Guys, you won't believe it! Our guys in the Clear Sky found some kind of entrance to the underground, and there are just tons of artifacts there! They say they couldn't even carry it all, it's like a gold mine!
Hmm, looks like it's Zhablikov's brother. Perhaps it's worth informing his brother about the unpleasant news.

%c[255,160,181,169]General channel:\n%c[255,245,240,218]They found what seems to be an entrance to the underground communications at Rostok, connecting part of the territories. They say they've seen a lot of artifacts there.
%c[255,160,181,169]Elder:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Hey, you, come over... There's something to talk about with you, man.
Messer, what's up with the stash? Waiting for you eagerly.
Ready, scoundrel! Thanks for the help, stalker. I'll put in a good word for you at the bar.
%c[255,160,181,169]Raven Eye:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, don't shoot! I know for sure you're here, I've tracked your computer!
Leader of Duty: Messer, come to me. I think we can talk without any problems now.
%c[255,160,181,169]Digger:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Alright, go ahead. You can head towards the Dump, and I'll change clothes for now... Don't worry, I'll catch up.
To check the PDA charge level, press the TAB button in the PDA window.
To scale minimap scale use - and +.
Remember, fighters! We are the barrier, and no creature, no piece of paper, no item should slip through to the outside world. The Zone gave birth to them, and here they will be buried!

Oh, one more thing, Messer. Let me share some information with you: if you encounter an emission at our checkpoint, hide by the rocks, next to the fence - these rocks provide good protection from it. Well, that's it, thank you.

Alright... Damn, rats infested the hangars again! They keep coming from the Dark Valley... What are they breeding there? Messer, you can enter the Bar territory, we'll let you through. The main bar, where stalkers gather, is closed now, but you can come to our base, maybe there will be something for you.
Rock over London, Rock over Chicago
Monsters... Seems like they're coming from the North. Maybe after the installation at the lake stopped working. Where are there so many of them from? Messer, hold the point, we'll cover the rear!
Come to me, stalker... Come...

Messer, are you near the village right now? There's an issue... A drifter was supposed to bring me something from the Bar but disappeared somewhere in this area. Go check it out, see what's there, and if you find anything, bring it to me immediately. That's it, end of communication.
%c[255,160,181,169]Companion:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Damn, what was that? Oh, feeling kinda crappy...
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Damn, what just happened?! Are you okay? Need help?
%c[255,160,181,169]Companion:\n%c[255,245,240,218]No, I'm good... Oh, could use a little rest... Let's go to that fallen tree... I'll take a medkit now, and then we'll move on, oh...
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Damn, what was that with him just now? Hmm... I'll stay for now, need to bury the guy...
%c[255,160,181,169]Messer:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Damn... Zhaba, I'm having issues with my suit, respond.

%c[255,160,181,169]Toad:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Could you have been a bit more cautious at least? Alright, if you're not in the complex area right now, and there's no radiation, run to me, I'll fix it up. But if you're there, you're in trouble, stalker. Alright, let me think... Hehe, maybe you could try making a dash with medicine, although it's not guaranteed to work, and you'll glow brighter than the reactor afterward. Or wait... There were some experiments with experimental anti-radiation treatments at the complexes. I think someone told me they work great against radiation at the Research Institute. Try searching the complexes, maybe there are remnants of them lying around.
%c[255,160,181,169]Companion:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Hmm, what's that there? Looks like a dead drop. Need to check, maybe we can find a needle!
Stalker, come to my shack, we need to talk.
Well, here we are, at the Dump.

%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Oh, it seems you've succeeded... Come to our bunker, we have some information for you. Oh, and don't forget the emulator hat.
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Looks like there's some signal, some interference... Be careful.

%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Messer, take them out, but do it quietly: leave no witnesses and don't let yourself be detected! As soon as you're done with them, leave the village immediately, you shouldn't be noticed in that area."
%c[255,160,181,169]Professor:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Excellent, climb up to the bunker roof.
Pilot:\nHoly crap, he's got an RPG! Stalker, take him out! He's hiding near the ruined building, hurry!
Pilot:\nObserving suspicious activity in the area. Seems like a local gang. Stalker, the professor said he sent you to cover us - deal with them. They're running from the roofless building.
Junior Assistant\nAlright, it seems that's everything. The final push remains: we're circling around the complex back to base. Keep your gun ready and cover me if needed.
%c[255,160,181,169]PDA:\n%c[255,245,240,218]New contact - access error
%c[255,160,181,169]Snitch:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Acknowledged. Got the password for your case. Whenever you can, drop by and don't forget the case yourself, and 200 coins for the job.

%c[255,160,181,169]Toad:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Oh, and one more thing: you have a special notepad in your PDA for notes. You can write down your findings there if you come across anything interesting.
More info for you: radiation everywhere you look, so I'm sending you a brief overview on it and what to expect. Make sure to read it, or you won't survive any longer, no doubt about it.

%c[255,160,181,169]%c[255,160,181,169]Toad:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Stalker, there's a lot of psi radiation activity in the city, blocking the way to the station. I've spotted a large group of controllers somewhere in the city center, maybe it's them causing the trouble. I recommend using the Dead Head artifact, and not just one, in that area.
Unknown stalker

%c[255,160,181,169]Zyblikov:\n%c[255,245,240,218]Thanks again for the help. I've decided to leave the Zone - I have nothing more to do here. To leave before it claims me too. I'll give you a lead to my stash, it's of no use to me anymore. Farewell.

No electricity...
No electricity...
Stalker... Come in, we need your help... We're in the village... in the house.

You've gone too far, no matter how hard we tried to stop you. We didn't believe anyone could penetrate through all our defenses, yet you almost managed it. Just tell us, why do you want this? Do you desire so strongly to know who's behind all this? Are you trying to find out who created the Zone?

We can satisfy your curiosity. But we cannot allow anyone to leave the lab with this knowledge. It's dangerous for us and for achieving our goal. We hope you can understand us. Your life is the price for the information we'll share with you.
Who are you?

We are a group of scientists who have set out to change the world for the better. We believe it's possible by making changes to human nature. In our understanding, humans are burdened with evil. If we remove evil or at least reduce its concentration, it will save humanity from self-destruction.

We built a device that allowed us to merge people's consciousnesses together. The power of one person's consciousness is not enough to achieve our goal. With the device, we could connect to the Noosphere, the Earth's information field. The Noosphere contains the thoughts, images, and emotions of all intelligent beings. We intended to remove from humans everything that makes them commit evil against their fellow beings.

We were not prepared for the experiment to connect to the Noosphere to go awry. It resulted in the first ever emission of anomalous energy in human history. The power of our consciousnesses was only enough to create a breakthrough. But we couldn't close it or influence human nature in any way.

We are aware of the danger the Zone poses to humanity now and we're trying everything in our power to stop it. However, there are those who hinder us from eliminating the consequences of the failed experiment. That's you. Stalkers. Your influence on the Noosphere is equivalent to how it affects our planet. You're inherently cruel, aggressive, and dangerous. There are too many of you here. Your thoughts, your images, and memories shape the Noosphere and fill it with energy.

At some point, the energy becomes too much, leading to an emission. The breakthrough expands. Our goal now is to restore life to its former course and prevent the spread of the Zone worldwide. It's very difficult when there's an unaccounted-for element that undermines years of work. At some point, we had to focus all our efforts on preventing you from entering this laboratory.
We hope you don't condemn us for what we've done. The road to Hell is paved with good intentions. But all of this was done only for the sake of humanity...

The consequences of your actions will be very difficult to rectify. We cannot allow the rest of the world to know the truth about what's really happening in the Zone. Humanity is not ready for it yet. And you, stalker, are direct proof of that.
